author: wzht
content: Yeah it looks like the minimum.. "primitive" (for lack of a better term; maybe "compilable-executable-unit") is a `Contract` for Solidity's compiler. As I implement more and more of the EVM I wonder what the minimum _manual_ "primitive" is that others can call. It'll be interesting but I imagine compilers like Solidity already produce something pretty small even with the extra hash checks appended to the end of the bytecode that they add (IIRC).

author: wzht
content: I suppose in some sense what I am barking up here is how you can have assembly that adds two numbers but within the context of $OPERATING_SYSTEM that is not a valid _executable_ because you need the appropriate headers, any linking and so forth which adds instructions.
